scenarioDescription:
The HD 94834 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 94834 is a star with 1.11 times the mass of the Sun, and 4.2 times its radius. It is located 320.16 light years away from the solar system.

HD 94834 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 94834 system


HD 94834 b

HD 94834 b was discovered by the W. M. Keck Observatory observatory, in 2019-04, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 2.74 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 94834 b is 400.680 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 94834 b is 13.700 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 94834 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 94834, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the W. M. Keck Observatory.
name: HD 94834 - System With 1 Exoplanet
